alert.note: Alert for Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oneida County through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pleasantview, or 9 miles southwest of Malad, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pleasantview and Samaria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Extremely heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and ponding of water on roadways. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
